column2: Kraft Heinz bids $143 billion for Unilever in global brand grab LONDON U.S. food company Kraft Heinz Co made a surprise $143 billion offer for Unilever Plc in a bid to build a global consumer goods giant
column3: although it was flatly rejected on Friday by the maker of Lipton tea and Dove soap. | Video  ~UPDATE 8-Kraft Heinz bids $143 bln for Unilever in global brand grab * Unilever shares touch record high; Kraft Heinz stock up 10 pct   (Adds Moody's note) ~

column2: UPDATE 2-Citigroup cuts CEO Corbat's pay after missing financial targets Feb 17 Citigroup Inc's board of directors cut Chief Executive Officer Michael Corbat's compensation by 6 percent last year after the bank missed financial targets and one-third of its voting shareholders disapproved of his prior pay package. ~

column2: 3G Capital's austere empire-building weighs on Kraft's Unilever bid Buyout firm 3G Capital managed to build a consumer empire with a market value of over $140 billion in just seven years.
